result.execSummary:
The defendant John C Krumenacher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Apply 23 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Cases 15CM606 & 15CM722.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied - PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with Pick N Save.
Cases 15CM668 and 15CM770 were dismissed and read in.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 70 days sentence credit.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Probation revoked, sentence imposed.

Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John C Krumenacher in court, in custody, with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  

State presented their recommendations.
Defense presented their recommendations.

Court orders the following:
180 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
70 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  15CM246 & 15CM606

Any outstanding costs/fines/surcharges can be converted to a civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-24-2016 01:45 pm

ADDRESS INFO for John C Krumenacher
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 01-28-2016)
Prior: 200 N Brookfield Rd, Brookfield, WI 53045
with attachments filed by Department of Corrections.
Letter to defendant from court denying his request at this time to go to Mexico for his niece's wedding.

Filed by the Defendant, requesting the court allow him to travel out of the country to Mexico for his niece's wedding from 06/20/16 - 06/27/16.
12/29/15 - Court reviewed would allow if no violations between now and June.
01/06/15 - Based on notification of the defendant being in custody on 12/29/15 for a PO HOLD for a PO Violation of drinking court denies the request to leave the country at this time.
**no paper copy in physical file**

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.  
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John C Krumenacher in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen. 
Case called along with:  15CM246, 15CM606, 15CM668 & 15CM770.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.


Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
23 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation: 2 Years.
Concurrent to:  15CM606 & 15CM722
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
No Contact with:  Pick N Save.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs: $243
DNA SURCHARGE: Court Waives.
Apply Bail and Refund the Balance to the Posting Party.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Order Denying - Defense Bail Modification.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 04/22/15.

Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John C Krumenacher in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  
Case called along with:  15CM606, 15CM668 & 15CM246

Defense waiting on a consolidated offer and discovery on the three newest files.

Atty. Van Severen presented arguments for bail modification.
State objects and presented arguments.

Court Denies - Defense request for bail modification.
Bail and Conditions remain as previously fixed.
Court signed order.
All parties received a copy of the order in court.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant John C Krumenacher in court, in custody, with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
